Review: Long-time Zac Efron stan here. No, I don’t know what happened to his face, but it kinda works for this movie. He literally embodies the macabre vibe that dominates the film, with little relief provided by brief moments of tenderness and pure fantasy. I was amazed by the story Durkin drew out of one of those evangelical death-traps we call “families” in this country. Horribly sad and disturbingly familiar. Incredible acting from all sides. So good even Jacob cried.

My grandma hated this as a “real chainsmoker” who couldn’t look past Bradley Cooper’s impersonation of a cigarette addict, or his generally hammy portrayal of Bernstein. But, as you can imagine, all the music featured absolutely killed. Carey Mulligan is incredible. I’m not a hater— I got invested. Definitely watch on a big screen if possible, I can imagine a lot of the magic being lost on a laptop.
Lots of good product design easter eggs for those who partake. Big Short x Social Network with even weirder-looking dudes so get watching girlies!
Fuck you Hitler we put boys in a boat!!

Overall extremely moving and, in the words of my mother, “beautiful to look at.” I loved the focus on Nora/Na Young’s desires outside of love despite the love story theme, and thought the performances were incredible all around. Would have liked more character and world-building— I didn’t feel particularly invested in the story aside from knowing that I should be because I sat down to watch the movie. Our tradition is to watch this and cry so hard we pass out until xmas. Totally forgot about Auld Lang Syne— slaps.

i had a dream that i met yorgos lanthimos and i thought “he looks like some guy.” i love his movies and i loved this. made me laugh and exclaim and have a good time. and i love when the movie is about a girl.
I’m a good sport but this was NOT it. Highly entertaining tho.

Stunner. I didn’t notice that 2.5 hours had passed until we emerged from the theater into the dark dark night. Truly an outstanding film with terrific writing and performances all around. Toys with the audience the entire time, dragging or firing you into different perspectives before you know what to do with what you just saw. And the Grenoble prosecutor’s rabid pursuit of “justice”…. too good!

Came back for more Crone and what a reward. Toes the funny scary sexy grotesque line sooo perfectly. Once again struck by the impeccable set and prop design, as well as the uncanny feeling that I might still be in the game…
